column4: Hi. Brand-new clean Ubuntu 12.04 install. How do I get 'nvidia-detector' to return something other than 'none'?
computer has GT-650M card...
http://www.linuxcandy.com/2012/06/the-nvidia-fiasco.html
Ugh. Ok. I've been aware of this, but thought Nvidia supporte 650M. Maybe not. Is Bumble 64-bit? I tried that with another install, and got the impression it might be 32 bit only...
no idea. try here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bumblebee
you mean this? http://samiux.blogspot.se/2011/05/howto-nvidia-cuda-toolkit-40-on-ubuntu.html
you might want both :) better battery life then
I'll try that last link. Thanks. FYI I have this laptop: http://usa.asus.com/Notebooks/Multimedia_Entertainment/N56VZ/
Not sure if that has the 2 levels you refer to.
That link (http://samiux.blogspot.se/2011/05/howto-nvidia-cuda-toolkit-40-on-ubuntu.html) is for 11.04 and doesn't work for precise pangolin... :(.
dunno, that was the link the 12.04 bumblebee page provided at the bottom
What was it that didn't work?
W: Failed to fetch http://ppa.launchpad.net/aaron-haviland/cuda-4.0/ubuntu/dists/precise/main/binary-i386/Packages  404  Not Found
The "apt-get add-repository" line is this:  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:aaron-haviland/cuda-4.0
But must tweak itself for my system, precise pangolin.
http://d.hatena.ne.jp/iRiE/20120309/1331303439 for cuda 4.2
but according to the japanese blog above, they got it installed
OK I will try that. Also seems to be similar instructions here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QtPAJ9BR1W8
if you need anything translated I happen to know Japanese :P
Ok thank you. I'll try with cut-and-paste and google, but will ask if I need more help.
This page seems to be very similar to the japanese one: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Cuda And claims CUDA on 12.04. I followed the intsructions. Everything built, but the tests won't run...
